branches.text: You come across a dragon resting on a pile of gold. Its massive eye opens and fixes on you.
The dragon tilts its head. 'Hello, tiny creature,' it rumbles. Smoke curls from its nostrils.
You charge at the dragon with heroic (or foolish) determination. The dragon raises an eyebrow — or the scaly equivalent.
You turn and sprint as fast as you can. Behind you, the dragon's booming laugh echoes through the valley. 'Humans are funny.'
The dragon seems pleasantly surprised. 'It was a good day,' it says. 'I only burned one village by accident.'
You boldly flip off the dragon. It blinks slowly, clearly processing your gesture.

responses.response: Double down and insult its mother

branches.text: The dragon preens. 'Oh, thank you! I just shed last week,' it says happily. You might have just made a new friend.

responses.response: Ask if you can have some gold

branches.text: Your sword clangs harmlessly against the dragon's scales. It yawns. 'Are you done?' it asks.
You hurl a rock. It bounces off the dragon's nose. The dragon sighs deeply. You feel your courage melt.
You run until your legs give out. When you stop, you realize you're lost in a dense forest. Something howls in the distance.
You turn just in time to see the dragon waving... with a claw the size of a horse. 'Bye!' it shouts. You're oddly touched.
You nod respectfully. The dragon nods back. For a brief moment, there is peace between species.
The dragon squints. 'Would you like to become an accident?' it asks. You reconsider your tone.
You insult the dragon's mother. It stares at you in silence... then bursts into laughter. 'You're bold. I like that.'

responses.response: Run before it changes its mind

branches.text: The dragon tilts its head thoughtfully. 'Sure, take one coin.' You grab a coin roughly the size of a pizza and struggle to carry it.
You bow and leave. The dragon watches you go, humming softly. Somehow, you feel like you'll meet again.
The dragon sighs. 'Fine.' It snaps its claws and you vanish in a puff of smoke. You reappear in your bed — slightly singed.
‘Oh, an accident?' the dragon repeats. 'Of course it was.' It smiles ominously. The air gets very hot.
You climb the nearest tree. From above, you can see smoke rising from where the dragon rests. You're safe… for now.
